span: Bad screen / long tiring return process
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2025
review-text: This phone is great. I bought one came amazing. Still using it as I'm typing this. Bought another for my bf and it came with black dots on the screen. (Dead spots) they didn't make it easy to return and I don't have a car. Had to take ubers to even go to the return place. Then took about a month and a half to refund me the credits. So bf was with no phone for a whole month and a half because his broke hence why I ordered this to be here in 3 days lol then they tell me to get a refund I must return the broken phone first. Would be fine if I now wasn't 270 dollars down until a month and a half so to get a new phone for the mean time would've been crazy and a waste of money. Nobody will steal a broken phone. Even version gives you a lender when they mess up. That's insane they expect you to have no phone nor ur money back in a timely manner lmao. Rude customer service as well. Not a discount or even a thank you for previously buying a phone from them and giving a nice review.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2026
review-text: I ordered this product expecting it to come with factory settings, but it's asking for a PIN code from the previous user, and I can't format it either because it's asking for the previous user's email account.
a-color-secondary: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2026
a-size-base: I ordered this product expecting it to come with factory settings, but it's asking for a PIN code from the previous user, and I can't format it either because it's asking for the previous user's email account.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2022
review-text: This phone (Note 10+ 256GB) was purchased as a present. Since the seller was listed as Amazon Renewed Store,  I thought it would be a legitimately safe purchase, boy was I wrong. The phone itself came very nicely without any cosmetic damage with a new cord and generic charger. After installing SIM card from my phone carrier (Cricket), the phone show that it connected to the network. I was able to play around with it and use my data to download some apps. But then something odd happened, my mom complains to me later that day to say she was not able to call me and instead heard a recording that simply said "this caller cannot be reached". So I tried calling her, instead, it immediately goes straight to my carrier's customer service line. They ask what I need and I explain how I have new phone and I switched my SIM card to the Note 10+ and that I cannot make or receive calls, but I can use my data. She asks me to give the phone's IMEI number and looks it up. Before telling me what's up, she asks me in a curious tone how I obtained the phone in the first place, which I tell her I purchased it on Amazon. She then informs me that the phone itself is blacklisted from all networks because the phone was reported STOLEN and that it is impossible to make it usable. Darn, so much for that...

span: Good phone loved it 2nd in 6 months but recived broken
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2022
review-text: Loved type of phone 2nd in six months but recived broken purchased from amazon renued progam. In exellent condition sad when arived broken under the program ut says refund with in 7 days of return but had to spend over 8 hrs on phone with amazon about my refund even thoughit was recived i had to wait for over 40 days and still no refund was to they would refund and could not fux issue for minumum if 30 daya then 7 plus days after that all i wanted was a good phone replaced but cant get the money back to puchase other phone from here so if its a good phone great deal but if you have to return item super bad deal very tough to recive refund even though the advertise 7 days afer returned not true amazon billed me right away but kept my money during refund guess they were just useing my money to draw interest on there account im a disabled veteran and coyld not affourd to just buy another right away so just out money and phone 45 plus days reported to the attourney general decptive business practices and could not speak to any one in America at all know matter who or what manager out of country i spoke to ripping of a army veteran way to do business jeff/ amazon

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2021
review-text: I just got this phone in the mail. Came with a charger that gets burning hot smells like burnt plastic, should've been a red flag but I still gave the phone a chance. I open the phone to multiple scratches, okay cool I know its used at least its not cracked. I go through the process of turning it on following the instuctions and it still tells me its a Verizon phone. Okay, maybe I have to go through manually and do the IMEI number, THE PHONES IMEI NUMBER IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH MY CARRIER!?!  But its suppose to be a FULLY UNLOCKED phone!?! The packaging was terrible to begin with. A rolled up paper ball on one side, then it looks like the charger was just thrown in the box along with the phone with a piece of bubble wrap that didnt cover the entire phone. This is the second time ive tried ordering a phone on amazon for it to not work correctly because it was never fully unlocked. Returning it tomorrow morning as it was packaged. I took a video of myself unboxing everything and putting back in the box to avoid them refusing a refund. If you areba verizon user buy this phone its perfect for your carrier but dont do it for another carrier. That is all.

span: If you are not satisfied, beware..
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2021
review-text: Id love to say this was a great experience but it was not.. The phone arrived with a deep gouge on the screen which was very noticeable.. if this was just a surface scratch I probably could deal with it being a renewed phone. It is so deep I can catch my finger on it as I move across the screen. Tried to return for replacement and have been asked to jump through hoops.. Seller asked for "many pictures" of packaging ect. Said we would have to Put in a  claim with the carrier (shipper), and they had no resolution otherwise.. Reviews for this seller seem to be pretty good overall so I'm thinking I got an outlier when it comes to the quality of phone I received. That being said, with the guarantee you see at the bottom of the page trust me, if you have a problem it's not as easy as just returning the phone. You will be required to do extensive work to get a replacement if you get one at all. I'm still waiting.

span: Title: Do Not Buy from This Seller – Sells Defective Products and Refuses to Help
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2025
review-text: I purchased a renewed Samsung Galaxy Note 10+ from Bayshine Trading US, and it arrived defective—the screen had a frozen image stuck in the background. I contacted the seller immediately, expecting a resolution, but they refused to take any responsibility and hid behind the expired 90-day renewed warranty. A renewed product should work properly upon arrival, but this seller clearly sells faulty devices and avoids accountability. Their customer service is terrible, and they refuse to issue refunds or replacements even when they sell you a broken item. I highly recommend avoiding this seller at all costs. Save yourself the frustration and buy from a more reputable seller instead. Amazon should reconsider allowing them to sell on this platform!

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2025
review-text: Phone arrived powering down at 15% battery life. A full charge gives 4 hour charge at most. Sometimes 100% will jump to 12-15% in minutes. Buyer beware of this vendor. I am stuck with this POS.

span: It was a good phone at first then it all went downhill!!
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2025
review-text: I bought this phone for my wife in late January.  It was okay for about 2 months then It kept losing connection to the S pen that come in it. And it started slowing down about a month later and today 5-18-25 the screen quit working.  And of course the it is out of the 90 day return policy! This is the second time we have had problems with Amazon refurbished products.  We will not be purchasing anymore Amazon renewed products.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2025
review-text: Didn't come with instructions, any protective accessories, was also locked and in mandrin or some other Asian language and i couldn't get it to factory reset or turn off so I'm assuming the buttons are messed up as well. Not happy, i spent my whole paycheck on this phone just for it to not work.
